comment.author: 27089900@N00
comment._content: I love how they're balanced on the rock. At first I noticed the riding posture was a bit odd, then noticed they're not riding!

comment.author: 16419296@N07
comment._content: I guess, cameras of those days had no "sport" auto-function for moving objects :)

comment.author: 47432292@N05
comment._content: they pause for the camera, sweet!

comment.author: 68216716@N06
comment._content: Such a pity that for a glass negative of size 214mm x 164mm that the largest image in Flickr is only 89mm x 69mm at 300 pixels/inch.

comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/jenolan_history] A larger version is available on our catalogue. Click on the link for more detailed info - then two more clicks on the image will give you a large jpg.
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection

comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/jenolan_history] You can also get the large version (27.7 x 35.5 cm) through Flickr by clicking on the image and selecting 'all sizes'. This holds true for all our Flickr images - we generally upload the largest and highest res JPG version we have. If you need a higher res version, you can purchase one through our Document Supply Service www.sl.nsw.gov.au/using/copies/order_information.html
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection
